title: Spack not working on Cray machine trinitite (LANL) with intel@16.0.3 (PrgEnv-intel)
body:
I still cannot use spack on trinitite/trinity (LANL). Here is a basic walk through of the error:
- New clone of spack from today.
- Setup the compilers (I have attached the generated 
  [compilers.yaml](https://github.com/LLNL/spack/files/483661/compilers.yaml.txt) )

```
$ spack compilers
==> Available compilers
-- cce ----------------------------------------------------------
cce@8.5.3  cce@8.5.2  cce@8.5.0  cce@8.4.6  cce@8.4.0.219  cce@3.210

-- gcc ----------------------------------------------------------
gcc@6.1.0  gcc@5.3.0  gcc@5.3.0  gcc@5.2.0  gcc@4.9.3  gcc@4.8

-- intel --------------------------------------------------------
intel@17.0.0  intel@16.0.3  intel@16.0.3  intel@15.0.7  intel@15.0.5
```
- Attempt to build GSL

```
$ spack install -v gsl%intel@16.0.3
==> Installing gsl
==> Trying to fetch from file:///usr/projects/draco/vendors/spack.tt.20160920/var/spack/cache/gsl/gsl-2.1.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /usr/projects/draco/vendors/spack.tt.20160920/var/spack/stage/gsl-2.1-v7ivwkbsz36uzvscwnhkxgu2edikqqbs/gsl-2.1.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /usr/projects/draco/vendors/spack.tt.20160920/var/spack/stage/gsl-2.1-v7ivwkbsz36uzvscwnhkxgu2edikqqbs
==> No patches needed for gsl
==> Building gsl
==> './configure' '--prefix=/usr/projects/draco/vendors/spack.tt.20160920/opt/spack/cray-CNL-haswell/intel-16.0.3/gsl-2.1-v7ivwkbsz36uzvscwnhkxgu2edikqqbs'
checking for a BSD-compatible install... /usr/bin/install -c
checking whether build environment is sane... yes
checking for a thread-safe mkdir -p... /bin/mkdir -p
checking for gawk... gawk
checking whether make sets $(MAKE)... yes
checking whether make supports nested variables... yes
checking whether to enable maintainer-specific portions of Makefiles... no
checking for a sed that does not truncate output... /bin/sed
checking whether make sets $(MAKE)... (cached) yes
checking build system type... x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
checking host system type... x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
checking for gcc... /usr/projects/draco/vendors/spack.tt.20160920/lib/spack/env/intel/icc
checking whether the C compiler works... yes
checking for C compiler default output file name... a.out
checking for suffix of executables... 
checking whether we are cross compiling... configure: error: in `/tmp/kellyt/spack-stage/spack-stage-sb6uML/gsl-2.1':
configure: error: cannot run C compiled programs.
If you meant to cross compile, use `--host'.
See `config.log' for more details
==> Error: Command exited with status 1:
'./configure' '--prefix=/usr/projects/draco/vendors/spack.tt.20160920/opt/spack/cray-CNL-haswell/intel-16.0.3/gsl-2.1-v7ivwkbsz36uzvscwnhkxgu2edikqqbs'

See build log for details:
  /tmp/kellyt/spack-stage/spack-stage-sb6uML/gsl-2.1/spack-build.out

/usr/projects/draco/vendors/spack.tt.20160920/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/gsl/package.py:46, in install:
     45       def install(self, spec, prefix):
  >> 46           configure('--prefix=%s' % prefix)
     47           make()
     48           make("install")
==> Error: Installation process had nonzero exit code : 256
```
- Log files attached:
  - [spack-build.out](https://github.com/LLNL/spack/files/483669/spack-build.out.txt)
  - [spack-build.env](https://github.com/LLNL/spack/files/483670/spack-build.env.txt)
- Any thoughts about this error? Am I doing something wrong?
- This machine's front end (compile node) is identical to the back end.  They are both haswell. I am ignoring the back-end KNL nodes for now.
